On Mon, Aug 11, 2008 at 3:05 PM, toalexsmail <toalexsmail@...> wrote:
> Perhaps, you meant to use something like this
>> @RunWith(Suite.class)
>> @SuiteClasses(A.class, B.class)
>> public class MySuite {
>> @BeforeClass public static void doYourOneTimeSetup() {}
>> @AfterClass public static void doYourOneTimeTeardown() {}
>> }
> ?
> First of all, until recently I wasn't aware of this opportunity.
> Second of all, it is quite verbose and not very flexible.

toalexsmail,

I'm sorry for the long delay in answering.  Can you explain how you
would like it to be more flexible?  Thanks,

   David Saff
